metadata.Title: CVE-2022-38648 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Batik of Apache XML Graphics allows an attacker to fetch external resources. This issue affects Apache XML Graphics Batik 1.14.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbatik-java - 1.8-3ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: batik package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8-3ubuntu1+esm1').
